plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A popular spring-flowering bulb with bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers. Daffodils are among the first flowers to bloom in temperate regions, signaling the end of winter.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and North America
plants.funFact: Daffodils contain lycorine, making them toxic if ingested by humans or pets.

plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: Famous ornamental cherry tree known for its stunning mass of pink or white blossoms that herald the arrival of spring in Japan and other temperate areas.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late March to early April, sometimes late February in warmer areas
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, Korea, China), also cultivated worldwide in temperate zones
plants.funFact: The blooming period of cherry blossoms only lasts about one to two weeks before petals fall.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree producing cylindrical flower spikes with bright yellow flowers that attract many pollinators such as birds and insects.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round, with peaks in late summer and also in early autumn and early spring
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers produce large amounts of nectar and are a crucial food source for many Australian birds.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant that blooms in late winter and early spring with white or pale pink flowers, often flowering through snow in temperate regions.
plants.location: Central and Southern Europe mountainous regions
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose and can be toxic if ingested.
